data.name: Jam privateering disallowed
data.desc: King asks Gov of Jam to not encourage privateering or buccaneering against Sp by soldiers or inhabitants of Jam, though existing commissions are not ordered recalled
data.note:
he [King] has thought fit hereby to command him [Gov of Jam] to give no encouragement to such undertakings [privateering against Sp] unless they may be performed by the frigates or men-of-war attending that place [Jam] without any addition from the soldiers or inhabitants /v Haring 110 /[missg] CSPC 5 /
 [early 1664] Jam disallows public enlistment of men for trips against Sp /v Haring 110 /Rawl MSS A. 347
